body.p: Memphis, Tennessee, attorney and governor of Tennessee. Franklin County, Tennessee, native. Son of Isham Harris and Lucy Davidson Harris. Married Martha Mariah Travis Harris in 1843. Father of Eugene Harris, James Harris, Edwin Harris, Charles Harris, and Isham Harris. Attended Winchester Academy in Winchester, Tennessee. Clerk in Paris, Tennessee, in 1832. Merchant in Ripley, Mississippi. Attorney in Paris in 1841. Member of the State Senate of Tennessee tin 1847. Member of the House of Representatives of the United States in 1848 to1852. Governor of Tennessee from 1857 to 1862. Resident of Memphis in 1860. Owned five enslaved people in Memphis in 1860. Served as a volunteer aide de-camp in the Confederate Army from 1862 to 1865.
